timeline.bodyText:
For this,i am trying to get data from this newly created data set were i am specifying the alert with an id and its text,but i keep on getting .NoSuchTableException: alert
as seen here,https://pastebin.com/9J6zfFsn   Any thoughts on this cc  @ibacher  @dkayiwa
timeline.author: HerbertYiga
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,12 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
+<!--
+    This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public License,
+    v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this file, You can

+    graphic logo is a trademark of OpenMRS Inc.
+-->
+<dataset>
+	<alert alert_Id="12345" text="Testing the hibernate DAO"/>

replies.bodyText: @HerbertYiga That's because the name of the table for the Alert class is notification_alert. See the relevant Hibernate mapping file. Also not that, at a minimum, you probably need to set creator, satisfied_by_any, and alert_read and should set uuid.
replies.author: ibacher

timeline.author: HerbertYiga
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,8 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
+
+<dataset>
+	<notification_alert alert_id="2" creator="1" text="Testing hibernate Dao" date_created="2019-01-01 00:00:00.0"  date_to_expire="2020-08-08 00:00:00.0" satisfied_by_any="1" alert_read="1" uuid="16914264-e162-11df-9195-001e378eb69e"/>

replies.author: ibacher

timeline.message: Add new line at end of file

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure what, exactly, is being tested here. Presumably, we should create a new alert (rather than loading one from the database), save it, and assert that we can call getAlert() to get the expected alert.
timeline.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: @ibacher Hi ian,thanks for the reviews.I made the recommended changes here.cc @dkayiwa
timeline.author: HerbertYiga

timeline.bodyText: @ibacher   hi ian made a fix for this method,thanks

replies.bodyText: @ibacher   on squashing this, i get different commits that i never made using(git rebase -i master)
replies.author: HerbertYiga

replies.bodyText: @HerbertYiga That's kind of expected. Those commits are probably the result of changed committed to master. You don't have to worry about squashing things, though, as GitHub will handle that for us.
replies.author: ibacher
